subject: One Monkey Off My Back
event: The latest Wild Cards book, SUICIDE KINGS, is finished, and has just been delivered to our editor at Tor Books. Look for it in late 2009 or early 2010. For more details, check out the story on my News page. It's nice to have that one complete. Alas, this does not mean my back is monkeyless. Couple more still sitting up there, including King Kong, the dragon monkey. But you guys know about him. C'mon, ya filthy apes. Let's all get back to work.

comments.upictitle: just a guy made of dots and lines: erfworld plot
comments.article: Are the biplanes circling?  :)

Ya damn dirty ape. :)

But thanks for my Tuf Voyaging! I love it!
Looking forward to it.
And the book has a killer cover!
happy to hear suicide kings is done, with the rate i read at, i should be just about finished with busted flush by the time it comes out.
*nods* Ooook
Careful with those monkeys!  There was a newstory over the weekend about a chimp that went totally insane!

comments.upictitle: [not pictured]: meta Safiiru moodless collected nerdy
comments.article:
This seems like a wonderful time to be unnecessarily pedantic and remind everyone that apes and monkeys are not technically the same. Apes, including chimps, have no tails but can do the more flexible sort of arm movement at the shoulder that we also can but that most mammals can't. There are other differences, too, but this has always been the easy one for me to remember.

I'm sure this information will enrich the lives of everyone here!
That is why I prefer this author over others, subtle tip of the cap to the thing everyone wonders about.  Keep up the great work boss, will definitely check out this book when it comes out.
comments.subject: Nice touch

comments.article: 'Twas beauty killed the beast.

First, terrific avatar pic. I recall seeing some photos from the Spanish fans at Asshai with you at Gibraltar. The monkeys seemed very gregarious.

And wow, what a cover from Michael Komarck (who I will link for those who want to explore his art further)! Rustbelt's going to need some more Brillo pads.

and a Hugo nomination for the work he's done on the WILD CARD series alone.

The calendar art is astounding. We've had the first 2 prints framed to hang in the Tower of Books, just as soon as the work is finished.
comments.subject: Komarck deserves much praise

comments.article:
Congrats on finishing that!

Is it okay to pick up the Wild Cards books in any order, or will I be horribly lost if I pick up a later one first?

the beginning of the new series, INSIDE STRAIGHT, now out in paperback. Then you can go back and read the earlier books as you wish and can find them. Most are currently OP, but can be found used. If sales are strong on the new series, there's always a chance the older titles will go back into print.
comments.subject: best book to start with is
Re: best book to start with is
Re: best book to start with is

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: Do not taunt the howler monkeys.

***DISCLAIMER: The first part of this comment is a joke... a little jab at the actual comments that aggravate so many of us fans. I just wanted to be up front about that.***

Dag gone it GRRM I don't come to this blog to read about books or literary news! Where is the football info? I have been waiting on your mock draft for the G-Men and Jet-lags for over a week now. How about throwing us football fans a bone here? Just a little something?

***Okay Joke is over now for my real comment***

I am pleased to announce that a local Hobby shop I frequent, who doesn't even usually carry books of the non RPG variety, told me they think it will be possible to get me copies of the OP Wild Cards books from their suppliers. The owner said she would let me know within a week, so everyone keep your fingers crossed for me!
comments.subject: As a joke...

comments.article: =(  It hurts my heart that the internet is now such a place that mild teasing requires a disclaimer...but it does.
comments.subject: Re: As a joke...

comments.article:
I just leant a buddy my dream songs book and marked all the stories I thought were just awesome- I would honestly say ALMOST the entire collection was good, but some were freakin' real good. Let's be realistic.
But the one of a monkey on your back was fantastic. It reminded me of Outer Limits...or maybe even the New Twilight Zone. Guess thats pretty apt.

Anyway....can't wait for the release of A Dance with Gibbons, book five of A Howl of Apes and Lemur.

Perhaps we will learn who truly is the Chimp that was Promised...

Anyone see a spin-off coming?
comments.subject: Monkey business

comments.article: Damn you and your monkey taunting!  Posts like these are why I have come to hate Wildcards without even reading them.
Love your avatar on this!

I'm really looking forward to you dumping that one off your back.

I hope you'll come around to my area again when you finally do. I will make you Dragon cookies. With Monkeys on them.
comments.subject: About that Dragon Monkey...

comments.article: That monkey? I hardly noticed it, because I spent the weekend nose-deep in Windhaven. Your turn around time on that was notably faster than Amazon. Thank you, sir!
Woot!

That, sir, is a damn fine picture of Rusty and the gator. Or is that a crocodile? I don't know for sure.

Regardless, glad to see that monkey has climbed down from the perch.

Saint Dharma, patron saint of patience
comments.subject: Well...

comments.article:
Wow, is that Starship Troopers reference at the end?!

"ya wanna live forever?!"
Have you ever seen Avatar: The Last Airbender? A dragon monkey sounds like it would be a creature from that show.
That is one awesome profile picture.

comments.upictitle: Mr. Cryptic Poster: Good Ol' Steve
comments.article:
Your fans will wait (we really don't have a choice) and I rather have the book you want to write than one that was rushed.

Just quit monkeying around!
comments.subject: Take your time

comments.article:
*throws in a bunch of bananas*

Well, it might give you 10 minutes respite ...

x
But any progress on getting the older stuff, especially the elusive Black Trump books into print? Or better still getting Baen to stick them out as ebooks?
comments.subject: I'll look forwards to it

comments.article:
Baen Books long ago reverted the rights to the three Card Sharks volumes, so there's no chance they will be doing them as ebooks or any other kind of books.

We would still like to get the older books reissued by our current publisher, Tor. We're still working on that.
comments.subject: Re: I'll look forwards to it
Re: I'll look forwards to it
